channel.title: Case Study: iGate standardizing on TFS
channel.description: TFS has a many strengths. Two of them that I particularly like talking about are it's performance over a wide area network and the strong IDE integration available for both .NET and Java developers (the latter via Teamprise of...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Stephen+00:00
item.description:
This is very cool!
Still I am confused... How can you have 8 offices in 12 countries? Unless that means they have 8 offices in each of the 12 countries, or some offices sit on the border of two countries and count twice.
item.dc:creator: Stephen

item.title: Comment by Martin Woodward+00:00
item.description: You know, that is an excellent question.
item.dc:creator: Martin Woodward

item.title: Comment by Stephen+00:00
item.description:
I guess they could have telecommuters that expand the country count, but seems odd to count it that way.
By the way, when I view the add comment page from Firefox (3.0.11) I don't see the Captcha. That caused my post to fail. Really confused me till I fired up the page in IETab.
item.dc:creator: Stephen

item.title: Comment by Stephen+00:00
item.description: Ah, nevermind about the captcha. I had NoScript turned on for the site.
item.dc:creator: Stephen
